Description: Pottery jar made of Nile silt clay, with flat base, rounded shoulder and short neck with everted rolled rim, coated with a thick red slip and burnished.
Curator's comments: For excavations see E. R. Ayrton & W. L. S. Loat, 'Pre-dynastic cemetery at El Mahasna' (London, 1911). Marked H114 (a) on side in ink, although this vessel is not mentioned in the for this grave. Like Polished red ware P40e in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery.
